column2: TEXAS PERMIT TEST
Question Text
1. What does the pictured signal indicate?
column6: Drivers should walk more and drive less.
column8: A pedestrian may begin crossing the street.
column10: A pedestrian may not not begin crossing the street.

column2: 2. This road sign means:
3. This road sign means:
column6: Watch for vehicles entering from the side

column2: 4. If you begin to feel drowsy while driving, you should:
5. This road sign means:
6. This traffic sign warns you about:
column4: a hill or a downgrade up ahead on the road.

column2: 7. An octagonal sign means that drivers must:
column10: come to a complete stop at the marked stop line.

column2: 8. To avoid having to make an emergency stop while driving in traffic, drivers should:
column4: drive in the right lane only.
column6: look ahead and maintain a safe following distance.
column8: sound their horn to warn other drivers.
column10: drive slower than the flow of traffic.

column2: 9. This sign tells drivers that:
column4: they must stop at the next intersection.
column8: left and right turns are not allowed.

column2: 10. Keeping a space cushion between you and the other vehicles around you is important because it:
column8: gives you time to react to situations.
column10: keeps traffic flowing at a safe pace.

column2: 11. Drivers should allow a larger space cushion when stopping:
12. What is the first thing you should do if your wheels move off the pavement?
column4: Pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other drivers.
column8: Try pumping the gas pedal to increase pressure.
column10: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.

column2: 13. When driving behind a motorcycle, drivers must:
column4: remembers that motorcyclists have the right to use a complete traffic lane.
column6: share the lane with the motorcycle.
column8: pass the motorcycle in the same lane.
column10: drive on the shoulder beside the motorcycle.

column2: 14. When a stop is required at an intersection with no stop line or crosswalk:
column4: Drivers are required to slow down to make sure crossing traffic is clear.
column6: Drivers are not required to stop.
column8: Drivers should stop only at a place where the driver can see at least 100 feet on either side.
column10: Drivers should stop at the point nearest the intersecting roadway where the driver has a view of approaching traffic on the intersecting roadway before actually entering the roadway.

column2: 15. This road sign means:
16. This is:
17. A flashing yellow light:
column4: can be found before reaching a sharp curve.
column6: warns drivers to proceed with caution.

column2: 18. Blind spots around a large vehicle are _________________ than the blind spots around a car.
19. After you stop for a school bus, you must:
column4: wait until the red lights stop flashing.
column8: pass the bus before the red lights stop flashing.

column2: 20. This road sign means:
column6: A road joins from the right

column2: 21. Roads are most slippery:
column4: when it first starts to rain.

column2: 22. This road sign means:
23. You can pass on the right:
column4: when passing is restricted by parked cars.
column6: when a vehicle ahead makes a right turn.
column8: when a vehicle that is approaching from the opposite direction is prepared to turn left.
column10: when a vehicle ahead makes a left turn.

column2: 24. Vehicle stopping distance never depends on:
column4: the condition of your vehicle's brakes.
column6: the condition and type of vehicle tires.

column2: 25. If another vehicle is approaching you head-on in your lane, you should _______, sound your horn and brake.
column4: None of the other answers is correct.
column10: stay in the center of your lane

column2: 26. The first sign drivers see when approaching a highway-rail intersection is usually:
27. You may park or stop along the shoulder of the freeway:
column4: if you need to check your smartphone for directions.
column6: as long as you turn on your emergency flashers.
column8: if no part of your vehicle is on the road.
column10: only if you have an emergency.

column2: 28. An emergency vehicle that uses lights and a siren can be unpredictable. Why?
column6: The driver can legally pass red lights.
column8: Emergency vehicle drivers are not required to be careful.
column10: Emergency vehicles must go faster than the posted speed limit when it is safe to do so.

column2: 29. This road sign means:
30. In case of skidding, drivers should NOT:
column4: take their foot off the gas pedal.
column6: steer the car into the direction of the skid.
column8: pump the brakes gently if they are about to hit something.
column10: tap the gas pedal with their foot.
